item.title: All Major Resident Evil Games Ranked From Worst To Best
item.content:encoded:
Resident Evil is one of those franchises that everyone knows worldwide. From the claustrophobic confines of the Spencer Mansion to a cold, isolated village in Romania, to a scorching setting in Africa, fans have seen and done it all. Thankfully, Capcom continues to make new games, and with new projects being developed, let‚Äôs tap into the past and rank the main Resident Evil Games.

Insider Gaming is not ranking every Resident Evil game, as we‚Äôll be here all day. No one wants to know if the mess that is Umbrella Corps has enough T-Virus in the tank to fend off competition from Operation Raccoon City! No, 10 Resident Evil games are the subject of this ranked list, and it‚Äôs predominantly what are considered the mainline games in the series.

Controversy and cold takes are sure to ensue.

Every Resident Evil Mainline Game Ranked

10. Resident Evil Zero

There are always two immediate bones of contention for a Resident Evil ranked list: Who comes out on top, and who collects the Wooden Spoon. For my money, Resident Evil Zero earns the cutlery because it just isn‚Äôt that good, and one of the main reasons it‚Äôs borderline unplayable is the inventory system, which decided to do away with the traditional, magic inventory box system and have items be strewn around the game‚Äîleading to excessive backtracking.

  • More Insider Gaming: Is Resident Evil Requiem On Xbox Game Pass?

Billy and Rebecca‚Äôs storage space is so small that you‚Äôd think every item you were carrying was the size of a grandfather clock. It takes ‚Äòsurvival horror‚Äô to an exaggerated degree, and it doesn‚Äôt help that Zero has uninspired enemies and bosses and doesn‚Äôt boast a compelling story. Only a remake, making necessary gameplay improvements, could improve its future standing.

9. Resident Evil 6

You thought this would be last, didn‚Äôt you? Resident Evil 6 is hilarious. It‚Äôs so unhinged and unashamedly bonkers that you have no choice but to laugh at how outlandish and unserious it is. It‚Äôs no secret that Capcom‚Äôs fourth and fifth numbered games veered away from the intense survival horror aspects of the originals, but Resident Evil 6 goes so far off the beaten path that it ends up in Narnia.

The idea of multiple campaigns and the chance to use several iconic fan-favorites is a wonderful idea, but the execution is woefully hit and miss (mostly miss). Leon‚Äôs campaign is the clear standout, paying homage to Resident Evil‚Äôs roots, and it can be unironically enjoyable. If you cut Jake‚Äôs and Chris‚Äô campaigns and extended Leon‚Äôs and Ada‚Äôs, there would actually be a pretty good Resi game here. Instead, it‚Äôs seen as the catalyst for change‚Äîcausing Capcom to go back to the drawing board afterward, and if you want to have this in the number ten spot, I don‚Äôt blame you.

8. Resident Evil 3 Remake

Do you go with the remake or the original? Another question that applies to several entries on this Resident Evil games ranked list. For convenience and relevance, the remakes are getting the nod, which is why the Resident Evil 3 Remake ranks so low. There are just better games, for one thing, but the remake loses a lot of the heart and soul of the original‚Äîand content.

The Nemesis encounters are terrifying, but few and far between, and feel quite inorganic. Also, why is one of gaming‚Äôs most distinguishable enemies wearing a giant bin liner? Jill is fantastic, and so is the narrative, and Nemesis will still make you change your underwear after every showdown. You might enjoy the original more, but here, the Resi 3 Remake comes in at number eight.

7. Resident Evil Village

If Resident Evil 7: Biohazard was the game to get the franchise back on the rails, Village quickly gets bored and taps into the franchise‚Äôs bad aspects again. Village pretty much peaks once you finish up the Castle Beneviento portion of the game, and given how much hype there was for Lady Dimitrescu, her role is more stunted than it should‚Äôve been.

Village looks and feels spectacular and leans more heavily into Resident Evil 4 for inspiration. You‚Äôre not short of action, but the game feels linear, and the story is somewhat disjointed. There‚Äôs also too much action again‚Äîwe won‚Äôt even touch on Chris Redfield‚Äôs Call of Duty action sequence at the end of the game. Resident Evil Village is fine and fun, but it‚Äôs a definite step back.

6. Resident Evil 5

It needs to be said: This is the most underrated Resident Evil game, and it‚Äôs not even close. Five unfairly gets the flak for being the first true ‚Äònon-Resident Evil game.‚Äô Indeed, the sun-scorched tropics of Africa don‚Äôt scream dark, despair, and desperation, but the intense Manjini sequences instil a different breed of scares and tension.

  • More Insider Gaming: Resident Evil Requiem Trophy List

The game‚Äôs antiquated control scheme shows its age, though, making some battles far harder than they need to be and frustrating. Lots of Resident Evil 5 involves fighting multiple enemies in tight spaces, and the tank-like controls can leave you wanting to punch more than just boulders. I also have to say how much I love getting the tiniest scratch, only for Sheva to blast me with a full First Aid Spray. Still, the game‚Äôs mission structure is a blast, and there‚Äôs some seriously good gameplay here‚Äîplus a decent story with appearances from Wesker and Jill.

5. Resident Evil 7: Biohazard

One of my biggest complaints with Resident Evil games is that they have a tendency to fall flatter than a pancake toward the end. The first two-thirds of Resident Evil 7 are nothing short of exceptional, and it‚Äôs unbelievable how much tension and panic the new first-person perspective adds. Jack Baker‚Äôs dynamic AI keeps you on your toes, and it has some of the best boss battles in Resident Evil history. If you really want to hate yourself, play this in VR!

So, where does it go wrong? Ethan Winters is the most boring and non-descript hero (he improves in Village), the delicate pacing descends into a tired slog of combat once you reach the ship, and the final boss fight and ending overall are just such a letdown from the game‚Äôs promising early hours. If you savor the first huge chunk of the title, you have the most survival-horror-driven entry since Resident Evil 3, and it might be the best atmosphere Capcom has ever delivered.

4. Resident Evil

It would be a crime to put this any lower. The original 1996 Resident Evil is the type of game that should adorn the hallways of any video game museum or archive. Its influence is immeasurable, and it managed to create a disgustingly tense and titillating experience with limited 90s gaming tech. However, this entry is based on the 2002 GameCube remake, as it remains the optimal way to enjoy it‚Äîfor now.

The methodical pacing ensures you get a nice snippet of Zombie action with limited supplies before finding items, solving puzzles, and SNAKE-ing your way through the Spencer Mansion and beyond. The story is subpar as it‚Äôs finding its feet, and the legendary dialogue is so bad it‚Äôs‚Ä¶well, bad. Regardless, many of the games you play in 2026 have likely been influenced by Resident Evil in one way or another, and it remains a classic and staple of the survival horror genre it created.

3. Resident Evil Code: Veronica X

Resident Evil Code: Veronica was a system-selling monster that dwarfed many of its contemporaries at the time. Then, Resident Evil Code: Veronica X made some subtle additions, making it the most complete way to play Code: Veronica. There‚Äôs something special about getting a Chris and Claire story, and unlike Resident Evil 7 and 8, this is one of the best stories that actually gets better the further you progress.

Writing this list in 2026 is tricky because there‚Äôs a common complaint about the older games that rears its head again: Controls. It was a deliberate design choice by Capcom early on that grows very tiresome in subsequent releases‚Äîwhich is why recent games have been a delight with their freeing movement. The story really pulls its weight here and makes Code Veronica worth playing again‚Ä¶and again.

2. Resident Evil 4 Remake

Now for bone of contention number two: Resident Evil 4 or Resident Evil 2? It all depends on what YOU are looking for in a Resident Evil game. As this is Insider Gaming‚Äôs list (and my thoughts), I prefer brains over braun, which is why Resident Evil 4 takes the second spot. The remake highlights why the fourth mainline game was so groundbreaking at the time and still holds up. It seamlessly blends action, survival sequences, and epic boss fights, and delivers a compelling (and kooky) story throughout its extended duration.

  • More Insider Gaming: How Long To Beat Resident Evil Requiem?

It‚Äôs much longer than most Resident Evil games, giving you real value for money. Nearly everything about it is memorable: The opening village siege, the cart ride, the monster on the lake‚Äîit‚Äôs Resident Evil heritage. While the game is action-oriented, there‚Äôs still plenty of horror. Seeing a Garrador fills my body with panic, and hearing a Regenrator is still enough to make me want to turn the game off.

Babysitting Ashley does hurt the pacing, I‚Äôm not gonna lie. It‚Äôs one aspect of the game I always hate and dread, but regardless, this is a masterpiece.

1. Resident Evil 2 Remake

Another masterpiece is Resident Evil 2: I haven‚Äôt a single bad thing to say about this game. When it was revealed that Capcom was remaking Resident Evil 2 with a new third-person camera, the Resi community went into overdrive. Yet, the remake keeps everything that made the original game so amazing, and I would argue betters it.

The puzzles are perfect, every location feels meaningful and suspenseful, and Leon Kennedy is such a likable protagonist. Where Nemesis feels sporadic and watered down in the Resident Evil 3 Remake, Tyrant (more commonly known as Mr. X) is a constant menace that keeps you on your toes from start to finish. With potentially four unique playthroughs to experience as Leon and Claire, there‚Äôs content for days. Capcom nailed the Resident Evil 2 Remake, and it brings home the bacon for this list.

The Insider Gaming Discord isn‚Äôt just free to join, it‚Äôs a safe place to talk all things gaming and share your thoughts on everything, including certain Resident Evil game ranking lists! If you agree (or presumably disagree) with any of these placements, head there and share your opinion‚Äîit‚Äôs all a bit of fun at the end of the day.

IG has more lists to check out:

  • Best Steam Deck Alternatives
  • 5 Best Games Like Escape From Tarkov in 2026
  • 10 Best Zombie Games to Play in 2026

item.title: Campaign Progression Details Revealed For Forza Horizon 6
item.content:encoded:
New details have been revealed for Forza Horizon 6‚Äôs campaign structure, giving players a clear picture of what to expect from the open-world progression system when the game launches in May 2026.

The latest blog from Playground Games outlines how the campaign in Forza Horizon 6 blends exploration and Festival challenges across a sprawling Japan setting. Rather than jumping in as an established festival Superstar like in previous titles, players begin their journey as a tourist with ambitions of joining the Horizon Festival and eventually becoming a Legend.

Campaign Focuses On Growth & Exploration

Playground Games‚Äô campaign approach emphasises progression through performance and discovery. To qualify for the Festival, you must complete Horizon Qualifiers and the Invitational to earn your first Wristband, unlocking access to curated races around Japan. As you earn more Wristbands by competing in Festival events, PR Stunts, and skills challenges, you will challenge increasingly demanding races featuring faster cars and varied terrain.

Progression isn‚Äôt limited to structured Festival competitions. Forza Horizon 6 also offers Discover Japan, a more free-form experience where you earn Stamps by photographing landscapes, completing side activities like Touge Battles or night street races, and exploring cultural hotspots. These activities reward cars, credits, and cosmetic items tracked in the game‚Äôs new Collection Journal.

Both paths‚ÄîFestival Wristbands and Discover Japan‚Äîfeed into campaign advancement, giving players flexibility in how they approach their journey. Reaching the highest tier grants access to exclusive locations like Legend Island, featuring intense events such as an extended Goliath race looping the full map.

The campaign is designed to play solo or in co-op with friends, with options to customise race conditions, vehicle selection, weather, and more once certain progression milestones are unlocked.

For full details, check out the blog post for yourself here.

Are you excited to get your hands on Forza Horizon 6? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more Insider Gaming news, check out how Bungie plans to tackle cheaters in Marathon, as well as the new leadership team for Assassin‚Äôs Creed.

item.title: WWE 2K26 Ringside Pass Pricing Details
item.content:encoded:
New details have been revealed about WWE 2K26‚Äòs Ringside Pass.

WWE 2K26 has revamped the DLC process with a new Ringside Pass system. This is more akin to the Battle Pass in Fortnite than to the old WWE DLC model. Ringside Pass Season 1 will go live on March 6, when the game hits Early Access.

Players can purchase the premium track of the Ringside Pass via a premium pass, but they will still need to grind through and play the game to attain the unlockables instead of having the ability to unlock everything outright, as was the case in the past when players purchased premium editions of the game.

WWE 2K26 Ringside Pass Tier Skips Priced Similarly to NBA 2K

A new video from Smacktalks on YouTube reveals further details about Season 1 of WWE 2K26‚Äôs Ringside Pass. The season will be centered around the AAA Lucha Libre Mexican wrestling promotion and feature four new superstars: Psycho Clown, Lady Flammer, Mr. Iguana, and El Hijo Del Vikingo. There will also be new arenas and championships based around AAA.

However, it was also revealed that players can purchase tier skips. However, it was noted to be priced similarly to NBA 2K, which is $1.99 per tier. Therefore, it would cost nearly $80 ($77.61) to skip all premium-tier options in Season 1.

Ringside Pass Seasons Don‚Äôt Expire

In some good news, players don‚Äôt have to rush to grind through and unlock everything, as the Ringside Pass Seasons do not expire. Therefore, players can still unlock everything at their leisure.

One of the game‚Äôs developers is confident that fans will enjoy the new DLC system overall. They believe that this allows for more content for the players. Read their full comments here.

Insider Gaming will provide more news regarding WWE 2K26 leading up to Early Access. Early Access is a little more than a week away, launching on March 6. The game will be available to the global public on March 13.

Does this news change your excitement levels about WWE 2K26? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Today‚Äôs Wordle #1711: Hints and Answer for February 24, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or a daily player, today‚Äôs tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak‚Äîif you‚Äôre open to a little extra help. So, if you‚Äôve found yourself stuck with today‚Äôs Wordle, don‚Äôt worry, below you‚Äôll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1711 for February 24, 2026

To play today‚Äôs Wordle, head to the game‚Äôs website. If you want to go right to today‚Äôs answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today‚Äôs and yesterday‚Äôs editions of Wordle. If you don‚Äôt want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, February 24, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1711 will give you a challenge. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today‚Äôs answer takes an average of 4.6 out of 6 guesses. That makes it just slightly easier than the 4.8-guess average from February 23.

General Wordle Hints For February 24

Without giving today‚Äôs Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word refers to a person, not an action or object.
  • Hint 2: It‚Äôs most often used in commercial or transactional contexts.
  • Hint 3: The role described only exists when two sides are involved.
  • Hint 4: You‚Äôre more likely to see this word in contracts, listings, or negotiations than casual speech.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1711 for February 24, 2026.

Starter Words For February 24, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today‚Äôs Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • BERRY
  • RUBLE
  • PAYER
  • ROUSE

Today‚Äôs Wordle Answer For Game #1711 On February 24, 2026

If you‚Äôve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today‚Äôs Wordle below.

Answer: BUYER

If you solved today‚Äôs Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow‚Äôs puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today‚Äôs Wordle Answer Mean?

BUYER is a noun that means ‚Äúa purchasing agent, as for a department or chain store‚Äù or ‚Äúa person who buys; purchaser.‚Äù

Yesterday‚Äôs Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here‚Äôs yesterday‚Äôs Wordle answer for Game #1710 on February 23, 2026

Answer: ATTIC

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1711?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on February 25 will be Wordle Game #1712.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn‚Äôt fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of‚Ä¶

More from Mike Straw

item.title: Shrouded Sky Update Notes‚ÄîWeather Project, New ARC Enemies, and Free Raider Deck
item.content:encoded:
Embark Studios has unveiled what‚Äôs coming in the Shrouded Sky update with a full blog post that details all. This includes a new player project to build a Weather Monitoring Station, the previously revealed Hurricane map condition, two new minor ARC threats, a free Raider Deck, and more.

It‚Äôs the most substantial update we‚Äôve had so far in 2026, and it‚Äôs the second of the four segments on the ARC Raiders roadmap released earlier this year.

Check out everything you need to know about Shrouded Sky below.

What‚Äôs Coming in the Shrouded Sky Update?

The heart of Shrouded Sky revolves around the new Hurricane map condition, which presents inclement weather that impacts everything. That includes visibility, physics, movement, and environmental hazards. It‚Äôs a major map condition that will change how you interact with every environment it lands on.

That‚Äôs also where the new Weather Monitoring System comes into play. This is the Shrouded Sky player project, and it requires users to collect specific materials (not yet revealed) to build the system itself and ‚Äòearn your Raider some rewards‚Äô. We‚Äôll have the latest on what‚Äôs needed for that tomorrow.

What we thought was one minor ARC enemy has become two new ARC threats. Embark Studios has unveiled two ARC enemies, one that flies and another that buzzes around the floor, and both look equally troublesome. Here‚Äôs their blurb:

The Firefly is a floating nightmare: an armored flying machine that emits a jet of flame, burning your Raider to a crisp unless you can move quickly or find cover. 

The Comet is a spherical ARC machine that calmly patrols the surface, until it comes across an unsuspecting Raider. You better not let this one get too close ‚Äì once it sees you, it will lock on with a frightening focus before exploding with a seismic boom.

Those looking for sweet rewards can bust their way through the new free Raider Deck, which is themed around the medical profession this time around. It‚Äôs called ‚ÄòSurgeon‚Äô, and it‚Äôs reminiscent of an old-timey doctor or nurse get-up. As always, you‚Äôll get these cosmetics by completing the Raider Deck, made accomplishable by completing Feats.

Facial hair is also confirmed to arrive with Shrouded Sky on February 24, giving players everywhere a way to adorn their Raiders with a thick scruff. From the word go, you can get stubble, but a full beard can only be unlocked via the Surgeon Raider Deck. In the store, ‚Äòstubble beard‚Äô and ‚Äòthick moustache‚Äô will be available from tomorrow.

Dam Battlegrounds has received a major overhaul, and the team at Embark Studios has added the Controlled Access Zone, a high-value loot area. Presently, we don‚Äôt know where that is.

As you can imagine, the rest of the update is comprised of cosmetics bundles, quality-of-life improvements, and some other balancing tweaks.

What are you most looking forward to from the Shrouded Sky update? Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out how Bungie plans to fight cheaters in Marathon

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more‚Ä¶

More from Grant Taylor-Hill

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem Leakers ‚ÄòDeserve A Thousand Deaths‚Äô, Says Ex-Capcom Director
item.content:encoded:
Iconic Capcom, PlatinumGames, and now Clovers dev Hideki Kamiya has commented on Resident Evil Requiem‚Äôs leaks, which arose after the game‚Äôs physical street date was broken by well over a week.

Resident Evil Requiem is 2026‚Äôs first major AAA game. Capcom‚Äòs franchise returns to a decimated Raccoon City. The hype has been huge, and the expectations are bigger than a skyscraper made entirely of El Gigantes. Unfortunately, countless buyers were able to get their hands on the game early, and it began a huge wave of Requiem spoilers.

Hideki Kamiya Not Happy With Resident Evil Requiem Spoilers

It‚Äôs not uncommon for a game‚Äôs physical street date to be broken, resulting in copies of the game being distributed days before launch, but Resident Evil Requiem went out roughly 10 days or more before launch. Leaks were inevitable, and social media was flooded with story spoilers and much more very quickly.

  • More Insider Gaming: Resident Evil Requiem Release Date & Start Times

Hideki Kamiya has shared his thoughts on the leaks and used a previous experience to summarize his thoughts. Here‚Äôs what he said, according to Google Translate:

‚ÄúI remember back with Bio2, the late-game plot twist got totally scooped by some photo weekly mag, right‚Ä¶ For your own selfish satisfaction, you‚Äôre trampling all over the feelings of users who were looking forward to it, and the feelings of the creators who poured their all into making it‚Äîa detestable act that destroys everyone‚Äôs happiness and deserves a thousand deaths‚Ä¶ May you be cursed to never play games again‚Ä¶

Kamiya directed Resident Evil 2, the first Devil May Cry, and Bayonetta, and has attached his talents to many other projects. Needless to say, he‚Äôs not someone you should want to disrespect.

Are you one of the many who have been fortunate enough to get the game early? Does the internet need filters to prevent this sort of content from being so easily discoverable? Let us know through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Check out the Resident Evil Requiem review embargo date for more on the game.

item.title: Bungie Outlines Plans To Counter Cheaters In Marathon
item.content:encoded:
Bungie has detailed its plans to combat cheating in its upcoming extraction shooter Marathon, outlining a firm strategy designed to safeguard competitive integrity ahead of the game‚Äôs March 5, 2026, release.

The Marathon team confirmed that the title will rely on dedicated server-side systems and integrated anti-cheat tools to detect and prevent illicit behaviour. And if those safeguards fail, the studio says offenders can expect swift and serious consequences rather than leniency.

Cheaters Will Be Given ‚ÄòNo Second Chances‚Äô

Bungie‚Äôs stance appears uncompromising: players caught cheating will face decisive enforcement with little opportunity for repeat offences. This contrasts with the more forgiving approach seen in rival extraction shooter ARC Raiders, whose developer Embark Studios has historically leaned toward lighter penalties. Bungie‚Äôs stricter policy is intended to reassure players that losses during raids should come from legitimate gameplay, not unfair exploits.

Still, the studio‚Äôs primary goal is prevention rather than punishment. Structural design choices aim to reduce cheating opportunities altogether. Because Marathon uses authoritative servers that control player movement, actions, and loot, it should be significantly more resistant to common client-side hacks.

Additional protections include a Fog of War system that limits how much information each player‚Äôs client can access at any given time. By restricting what data is visible locally, Bungie hopes to curb tools such as wallhacks or loot-tracking cheats before they can function effectively.

Bungie also addressed technical disruptions, noting that players disconnected mid-run will be able to rejoin matches. If server-side issues prevent that, the studio says it will attempt to restore lost gear to affected players.

For more information pertaining to Marathon‚Äôs network and security, check out the article in full here.

Do you think these systems will be enough to prevent cheaters running rampant in Marathon? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more Insider Gaming content, check out the newly announced Assassin‚Äôs Creed leadership team, as well as the upcoming Nintendo Treehouse Live.
